meanings.definition: A sudden and widespread disaster or collapse of the environment due to human activity.
meanings.sent1: The ecocatastrophe caused by the oil spill devastated the marine life in the area.
meanings.sent2: Scientists warn that if we don't take action, an ecocatastrophe could be imminent.
meanings.sent3: The ecocatastrophe was so severe that even the birds were looking for a new place to nest.
meanings.sent4: The looming ecocatastrophe cast a dark shadow over the future of the planet.
meanings.sent5: The images of the ecocatastrophe were a stark reminder of the impact of human actions on nature.

meanings.definition: The catastrophic consequences of environmental degradation and climate change.
meanings.sent1: The ecocatastrophe of deforestation is evident in the loss of biodiversity.
meanings.sent2: Communities around the world are already feeling the effects of the ecocatastrophe.
meanings.sent3: Despite the seriousness of the situation, some people still underestimate the ecocatastrophe.
meanings.sent4: In the face of the ecocatastrophe, urgent measures need to be taken to protect our planet.
meanings.sent5: The magnitude of the ecocatastrophe demands immediate attention and action from everyone.
